channel.title: Multiple parameter vectors on `glurmo` by example
channel.description: Recent content in Multiple parameter vectors on `glurmo` by example

item.title: Setting up
item.description: Multiple parameter vectors If we look at .glurmo/settings.json we will see a new change in addition to the one from the previous section: ... "N" : "@[100, 200, 300]", "beta_0" : "1", "beta_1" : "@[1, 2, 3]", ... Now, in addition to varying beta_1, we’ll be varying the sample size N as well. Setting up We can set up this simulation in exactly the same way as before. As always, ensure you are in the simulation directory and run:

item.title: Running
item.description: Running the simulation Finally, we will run the simulation in the same way as we did previously: $ glurmo -r 5 . You should see the following message: Successfully submitted 45 jobs Just to be explicit: we have submitted five jobs per setting, and there are three settings for beta_1 times three settings for N for a total of nine settings. The output, as always, will be saved to the results folder of each simulation subdirectory.
